Name: Information on free cardiopulmonary resuscitation courses available to the public.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information on free cardiopulmonary resuscitation courses available to the public

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) to make available on its website information on free cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) courses available to the public in New York City, and to update such information at least once annually.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17.188.1 to read as follows:
      � 17.188.1 Information on cardiopulmonary resuscitation courses available to the public. The department shall make available information on free cardiopulmonary resuscitation courses available to the public. Such information shall include, where practicable, the address of where each such course is provided, and the dates and times that each such course is offered. Such information shall be updated at least once annually, and shall be posted conspicuously on the department's website in English and in each of the designated citywide languages as defined in section 23-1101.
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
